alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 3:53PM MDT until May 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Gros Ventre River near Kelly affecting Teton County. .Temperatures remain slightly above normal through the week with scattered afternoon and evening showers and thunderstorms, especially Thursday and Friday. Therefore, active snowmelt persists in the mountains increasing water flows in the headwaters of the Gros Ventre River above Kelly. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Gros Ventre River near Kelly. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of low lying areas. Highway 89 pathway begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas increases and becomes more widespread. Highway 89 pathway is totally inundated with water. Water may begin to flow through Gros Ventre Campground sites that are near the river. River begins undercutting the Gros Ventre Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM MDT Tuesday, May 23, the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate each day between about 6.9 and 7.4 feet. Daily crests around 7.2 to 7.4 feet are likely to occur between 1 PM and 4 PM. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The fast-moving water may have eroded the soil beneath the bank. Also, do not attempt to swim in the river, as the water is swift and cold. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/riverton.
